alert.note: Alert for Miami (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 16 at 9:23PM EST until further notice by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM EST THURSDAY THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. 1 to 2 inches of rainfall with locally higher amounts. * WHERE...Portions of Indiana and Ohio, including the following counties, in Indiana, Dearborn, Fayette IN, Franklin IN, Ripley, Union IN and Wayne. In Ohio, Auglaize, Butler, Champaign, Clark, Clinton, Darke, Delaware, Fairfield, Fayette OH, Franklin OH, Greene, Hamilton, Hardin, Hocking, Licking, Logan, Madison, Mercer, Miami, Montgomery, Pickaway, Preble, Ross, Shelby, Union OH and Warren. * WHEN...From 7 AM EST Thursday through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Saturated soils and excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.
info.instruction: People in the watch area, especially those living in areas prone to flooding, should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Monitor the latest forecasts and be alert for possible flood warnings.
